title: Protect India's Forest Ecosystems
shortDescription: Supporting forest conservation and wildlife protection across India's biodiversity hotspots.
fullDescription: WWF India works to conserve India's forests through community-based conservation, anti-poaching efforts, and habitat restoration. Their programs focus on protecting endangered species like tigers, elephants, and rhinos while supporting local communities.

title: Create Safe Passages for Elephants
shortDescription: Building elephant corridors to reduce human-wildlife conflict and protect migration routes.
fullDescription: WTI's Right of Passage program creates and maintains elephant corridors across India, ensuring safe passage for elephants between fragmented forest areas. This reduces human-elephant conflict and maintains genetic diversity.
location: Assam, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal

title: Restore Western Ghats Biodiversity
shortDescription: Protecting and restoring the biodiversity hotspot of Western Ghats through community engagement.
fullDescription: FFI works with local communities in the Western Ghats to restore degraded forests, protect endemic species, and develop sustainable livelihoods. The program focuses on habitat restoration and species conservation.

title: Stop Deforestation in India
shortDescription: Campaigning against illegal logging and promoting sustainable forest management practices.
fullDescription: Greenpeace India's forest campaign works to expose illegal logging, advocate for stronger forest protection laws, and promote community-based forest management. They focus on policy advocacy and grassroots mobilization.

title: Revitalize Cauvery River Basin
shortDescription: Large-scale tree planting initiative to restore the Cauvery river basin ecosystem.
fullDescription: Cauvery Calling is a massive tree planting movement to plant 2.42 billion trees in the Cauvery river basin. The initiative supports farmers in tree-based agriculture, improving soil health and water retention.
